20110102190449.000|20110102190452.000|TR0|
20110102190452.000|20110102190454.000|TR0|When you're looking at killings by 
20110102190454.000|20110102190457.000|TR0|gunfire, fatalities by gunfire, 61 in 
20110102190457.000|20110102190459.000|TR0|2010; 49 in 2009.  So there was a big jump 
20110102190459.000|20110102190502.000|TR0|there.
20110102190502.000|20110102190504.000|TR0|

20110102190512.000|20110102190514.000|TR0|look here.

20110102190517.000|20110102190520.000|TR0|Law enforcement fatalities in traffic 
20110102190520.000|20110102190522.000|TR0|incidents, 73 in 2010; 51 back in 2009.  
20110102190522.000|20110102190525.000|TR0|So we're seeing it get a lot worse in that 
20110102190525.000|20110102190527.000|TR0|way.
20110102190527.000|20110102190530.000|TR0|
20110102190530.000|20110102190532.000|TR0|But I also want to tell you all that it's 
20110102190532.000|20110102190535.000|TR0|actually the opposite of what's going on 
20110102190535.000|20110102190537.000|TR0|in America in general, which is that 
20110102190537.000|20110102190540.000|TR0|violent crime is actually going down.  We 
20110102190540.000|20110102190542.000|TR0|just got this from the FBI the other day.
20110102190542.000|20110102190545.000|TR0|
20110102190545.000|20110102190547.000|TR0|Violent crime in this country has dropped 
20110102190547.000|20110102190550.000|TR0|6.2 percent in the first half of 2010 
20110102190550.000|20110102190552.000|TR0|versus first half of 2009.  So what we're 
20110102190552.000|20110102190555.000|TR0|seeing is unusual -- less crime in 
20110102190555.000|20110102190557.000|TR0|general, but more killings of officers. 
20110102190557.000|20110102190600.000|TR0|Property crime, by the way, has been 
20110102190600.000|20110102190602.000|TR0|dropping as well.

20110102190746.000|20110102190748.000|TR0|the Indian Ocean.
20110102190748.000|20110102190751.000|TR0|
20110102190751.000|20110102190754.000|TR0|The Navy is investigating raunchy videos 
20110102190754.000|20110102190756.000|TR0|produced and shown to the crew of the USS 
20110102190756.000|20110102190759.000|TR0|Enterprise. The videos first published 
20110102190759.000|20110102190801.000|TR0|yesterday by the "Virginian Pilot" 
20110102190801.000|20110102190804.000|TR0|newspaper are filled with sexual innuendo 
20110102190804.000|20110102190806.000|TR0|and anti-gay references.  They were shown 
20110102190806.000|20110102190809.000|TR0|to the aircraft carrier's crew in 2006 and 
20110102190809.000|20110102190811.000|TR0|2007.
20110102190811.000|20110102190814.000|TR0|
20110102190814.000|20110102190816.000|TR0|Now, the tapes feature a man identified by 
20110102190816.000|20110102190819.000|TR0|the paper and two Navy officials as 
20110102190819.000|20110102190821.000|TR0|Captain Owen Honors.  Honors was the 
20110102190821.000|20110102190824.000|TR0|Enterprise's second in command at the 
20110102190824.000|20110102190826.000|TR0|time.  In the tapes, he is shown cursing, 
20110102190826.000|20110102190829.000|TR0|along with other staff members, in an 
20110102190829.000|20110102190831.000|TR0|attempt to be funny.  Navy officials call 
20110102190831.000|20110102190834.000|TR0|the videos "unacceptable."

20110102190847.000|20110102190849.000|TR0|

20110102190854.000|20110102190857.000|TR0|terrorist attacks.  They've been fighting 
20110102190857.000|20110102190859.000|TR0|for almost 10 years for federal help with

20110102190952.000|20110102190955.000|TR0|FREDRICKA WHITFIELD, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  
20110102190955.000|20110102190957.000|TR0|As we ring in this New Year we look 
20110102190957.000|20110102191000.000|TR0|forward to more poignant and powerful 
20110102191000.000|20110102191002.000|TR0|moments "Face to Face" with remarkable 
20110102191002.000|20110102191005.000|TR0|people on the public stage.  2010 was a 
20110102191005.000|20110102191007.000|TR0|fabulous year, with a variety of people as 
20110102191007.000|20110102191010.000|TR0|diverse, impactful and far-reaching as you 
20110102191010.000|20110102191012.000|TR0|see here, from CNN founder Ted Turner, who 
20110102191012.000|20110102191015.000|TR0|shared with us "Face to Face" some of his 
20110102191015.000|20110102191017.000|TR0|big dreams and big defeats, to author 
20110102191017.000|20110102191020.000|TR0|Steve Harvey, who said good things could 
20110102191020.000|20110102191022.000|TR0|can from failures, to business mogul 
20110102191022.000|20110102191025.000|TR0|Russell Simmons, who redefines success 
20110102191025.000|20110102191027.000|TR0|without ever having a business plan.
20110102191027.000|20110102191030.000|TR0|
20110102191030.000|20110102191033.000|TR0|Then, there was author Catherine 
20110102191033.000|20110102191035.000|TR0|Schwarzenegger, trying to help young women 
20110102191035.000|20110102191038.000|TR0|and men rock what they've got, and author 
20110102191038.000|20110102191040.000|TR0|Salman Rushdie on both his memoirs about 
20110102191040.000|20110102191043.000|TR0|living with a year's long death threat and 
20110102191043.000|20110102191045.000|TR0|his latest projects inspired by his 
20110102191045.000|20110102191048.000|TR0|children.  Author Terry McMillan helped us 
20110102191048.000|20110102191050.000|TR0|get to happy while icon Pam Greer found 
20110102191050.000|20110102191053.000|TR0|many ways to make us laugh.
20110102191053.000|20110102191055.000|TR0|
20110102191055.000|20110102191058.000|TR0|A look back at "Face to Face" 2010.
20110102191058.000|20110102191100.000|TR0|
20110102191100.000|20110102191103.000|TR0|TED TURNER, FOUNDER, CNN:  My biggest 
20110102191103.000|20110102191105.000|TR0|regret, though, would be in losing my 
20110102191105.000|20110102191108.000|TR0|association with Turner Broadcasting and 
20110102191108.000|20110102191110.000|TR0|CNN.
20110102191110.000|20110102191113.000|TR0|
20110102191113.000|20110102191115.000|TR0|I would have liked to have been Captain 
20110102191115.000|20110102191118.000|TR0|Planet.  I would have liked to have been 
20110102191118.000|20110102191121.000|TR0|the ecological superhero.  I think at my

20110102193424.000|20110102193426.000|TR0|does every year.  It's difficult to look

20110102193628.000|20110102193630.000|TR0|about our computers?  Our technology

20110102193633.000|20110102193635.000|TR0|joins us via Skype from Toronto. 
20110102193635.000|20110102193638.000|TR0|Resolutions for your computer, Mark, this 
20110102193638.000|20110102193640.000|TR0|is a new one here.  Fill us in.
20110102193640.000|20110102193643.000|TR0|
20110102193643.000|20110102193645.000|TR0|MARC SALTZMAN, TECHNOLOGY ANALYST:  All 
20110102193645.000|20110102193648.000|TR0|right.  Thanks, Susan.  Well, number one 
20110102193648.000|20110102193650.000|TR0|is to back up your important files on a 
20110102193650.000|20110102193653.000|TR0|regular basis.  We all know we should do 
20110102193653.000|20110102193655.000|TR0|it, but rarely do we do it often enough.
20110102193655.000|20110102193658.000|TR0|
20110102193658.000|20110102193700.000|TR0|This includes your irreplaceable photos, 
20110102193700.000|20110102193703.000|TR0|videos, documents, e-mail addresses, just 
20110102193703.000|20110102193705.000|TR0|in case something happens to your 
20110102193705.000|20110102193708.000|TR0|computer.  Be it a nasty virus, theft, 
20110102193708.000|20110102193710.000|TR0|water or fire damage, you need to back it 
20110102193710.000|20110102193713.000|TR0|up.  You can do it very inexpensively with 
20110102193713.000|20110102193716.000|TR0|one of those little USB thumb drives.
20110102193716.000|20110102193718.000|TR0|
20110102193718.000|20110102193721.000|TR0|You can back it up online.  There are a 
20110102193721.000|20110102193723.000|TR0|number of free services.  If you have a 
20110102193723.000|20110102193726.000|TR0|lot of files invest in a relatively 
20110102193726.000|20110102193728.000|TR0|inexpensive external hard drive that can 
20110102193728.000|20110102193731.000|TR0|store many hundreds of gigabytes.
20110102193731.000|20110102193733.000|TR0|
20110102193733.000|20110102193736.000|TR0|HENDRICKS:  The next one is to serve and 
20110102193736.000|20110102193738.000|TR0|protect your computer so to speak.  Tell 
20110102193738.000|20110102193741.000|TR0|us about this one.
20110102193741.000|20110102193743.000|TR0|
20110102193743.000|20110102193746.000|TR0|SALTZMAN:  Sure, the second tip to keeping 
20110102193746.000|20110102193748.000|TR0|your computer safe in 2011 is to make sure 
20110102193748.000|20110102193751.000|TR0|you install and regularly update internet 
20110102193751.000|20110102193753.000|TR0|security software.  Just as you wouldn't 
20110102193753.000|20110102193756.000|TR0|leave your front door wide open when you 
20110102193756.000|20110102193758.000|TR0|leave your home, you should protect your 
20110102193758.000|20110102193801.000|TR0|computer even when you're not there.
20110102193801.000|20110102193803.000|TR0|
20110102193803.000|20110102193806.000|TR0|There's inexpensive and in some cases free 
20110102193806.000|20110102193809.000|TR0|anti-virus software that will protect your 
20110102193809.000|20110102193811.000|TR0|PC from malicious types in cyberspace and 
20110102193811.000|20110102193814.000|TR0|to stick with the analogy of your home, 
20110102193814.000|20110102193816.000|TR0|you should also not leave your back door 
20110102193816.000|20110102193819.000|TR0|unlocked when you leave the home because 
20110102193819.000|20110102193821.000|TR0|there's spyware.
20110102193821.000|20110102193824.000|TR0|
20110102193824.000|20110102193826.000|TR0|You can inadvertently download this 
20110102193826.000|20110102193829.000|TR0|software that can monitor your web surfing 
20110102193829.000|20110102193831.000|TR0|behavior and cause all kinds of nasty 
20110102193831.000|20110102193834.000|TR0|pop-up ads and tool bars that you don't 
20110102193834.000|20110102193836.000|TR0|want.  So you can also get free 
20110102193836.000|20110102193839.000|TR0|anti-spyware software at places like 
20110102193839.000|20110102193841.000|TR0|download.com.
20110102193841.000|20110102193844.000|TR0|
20110102193844.000|20110102193846.000|TR0|HENDRICKS:  And peaking of your home, you 
20110102193846.000|20110102193849.000|TR0|are supposed to keep that clean as is your 
20110102193849.000|20110102193851.000|TR0|laptop computer, right?
20110102193851.000|20110102193854.000|TR0|
20110102193854.000|20110102193857.000|TR0|SALTZMAN:  That's right.  Spring cleaning 
20110102193857.000|20110102193859.000|TR0|may be a few months away for us, but for 
20110102193859.000|20110102193902.000|TR0|your computers there's no time like now to 
20110102193902.000|20110102193904.000|TR0|do it for 2011. Get rid of those icons.  
20110102193904.000|20110102193907.000|TR0|If you have so many icons on your desktop 
20110102193907.000|20110102193909.000|TR0|that you can't even see the photo behind 
20110102193909.000|20110102193912.000|TR0|it, it's time to do some spring cleaning. 
20110102193912.000|20110102193914.000|TR0|But instead of just deleting the icon, 
20110102193914.000|20110102193917.000|TR0|which is just a shortcut to launch the 
20110102193917.000|20110102193919.000|TR0|program, go to your add/remove 
20110102193919.000|20110102193922.000|TR0|applications area of your control panel 
20110102193922.000|20110102193924.000|TR0|and take out the programs in full.  The 
20110102193924.000|20110102193927.000|TR0|ones you don't need any more of course.
20110102193927.000|20110102193929.000|TR0|
20110102193929.000|20110102193932.000|TR0|It's also a good time to do something 
20110102193932.000|20110102193934.000|TR0|called defragging your computer.  You 
20110102193934.000|20110102193937.000|TR0|don't have to understand what it does, but 
20110102193937.000|20110102193939.000|TR0|it's in the accessories part of your 
20110102193939.000|20110102193942.000|TR0|control panel.  It essentially sweeps 
20110102193942.000|20110102193944.000|TR0|through your hard drive and fixes common 
20110102193944.000|20110102193947.000|TR0|errors that can impact performance. So 
20110102193947.000|20110102193950.000|TR0|keep your computer clean in 2011 as well.
20110102193950.000|20110102193952.000|TR0|
20110102193952.000|20110102193955.000|TR0|HENDRICKS:  I'm going to use that walk up 
20110102193955.000|20110102193957.000|TR0|to someone say are you defragging?
20110102193957.000|20110102194000.000|TR0|
20110102194000.000|20110102194002.000|TR0|SALTZMAN:  Yes.
20110102194002.000|20110102194005.000|TR0|
20110102194005.000|20110102194007.000|TR0|HENDRICKS:  All right.  We also have to 
20110102194007.000|20110102194010.000|TR0|talk about passwords.  It's recommended by 
20110102194010.000|20110102194012.000|TR0|you to change your password a couple times

20110102194020.000|20110102194022.000|TR0|good passwords in 2011.  Many of us use 
20110102194022.000|20110102194025.000|TR0|the word password.  We use 12345 or our 
20110102194025.000|20110102194027.000|TR0|pet or child's name. These are easy to 
20110102194027.000|20110102194030.000|TR0|guess if someone wants to hack into your 
20110102194030.000|20110102194032.000|TR0|Facebook account or read Gmail or access 
20110102194032.000|20110102194035.000|TR0|files on your computer including your 
20110102194035.000|20110102194037.000|TR0|Wi-Fi password if you have a wireless 
20110102194037.000|20110102194040.000|TR0|network at home.
20110102194040.000|20110102194043.000|TR0|
20110102194043.000|20110102194045.000|TR0|So make sure you create and change often 
20110102194045.000|20110102194048.000|TR0|strong passwords.  Seven characters in 
20110102194048.000|20110102194050.000|TR0|length minimum is recommended and use a 
20110102194050.000|20110102194053.000|TR0|combination of letters, numbers and 
20110102194053.000|20110102194055.000|TR0|symbols.
20110102194055.000|20110102194058.000|TR0|
20110102194058.000|20110102194100.000|TR0|HENDRICKS:  And 12345 obviously not good.  
20110102194100.000|20110102194103.000|TR0|Maybe use a sentence or two, I don't know. 
20110102194103.000|20110102194105.000|TR0| Also don't be gullible.  Don't fall for 
20110102194105.000|20110102194108.000|TR0|scams out there in 2011.
20110102194108.000|20110102194110.000|TR0|
20110102194110.000|20110102194113.000|TR0|SALTZMAN:  Yes, there's some software that 
20110102194113.000|20110102194115.000|TR0|can protect you from malicious types out 
20110102194115.000|20110102194118.000|TR0|there to steal your identity for financial 
20110102194118.000|20110102194120.000|TR0|gain. I'm referring to what we call 
20110102194120.000|20110102194123.000|TR0|phishing attacks.
20110102194123.000|20110102194125.000|TR0|
20110102194125.000|20110102194128.000|TR0|This is when you get an e-mail that looks 
20110102194128.000|20110102194130.000|TR0|legitimate and it might look it comes from 
20110102194130.000|20110102194133.000|TR0|your bank or other financial institution 
20110102194133.000|20110102194136.000|TR0|asking you to verify your information.  
20110102194136.000|20110102194138.000|TR0|However, you're taken to a spoof website 
20110102194138.000|20110102194141.000|TR0|and voluntarily giving out your personal 
20110102194141.000|20110102194143.000|TR0|and confidential information.
20110102194143.000|20110102194146.000|TR0|
20110102194146.000|20110102194148.000|TR0|Don't fall for these.  There's no software 
20110102194148.000|20110102194151.000|TR0|that will protect you from being naive or 
20110102194151.000|20110102194153.000|TR0|gullible.  So make sure you just hit the 
20110102194153.000|20110102194156.000|TR0|delete button. If your bank needs to 
20110102194156.000|20110102194158.000|TR0|verify your phone number, they won't do it 
20110102194158.000|20110102194201.000|TR0|through an e-mail.  Just be web wise as I 
20110102194201.000|20110102194203.000|TR0|like to call it.
